quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [breathing heavy over intercom, starts laughing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: This morning the phone guy comes in, and he shows Michael that the phones have a PA function. And then he just left.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [over PA] This is your captain speaking, the office will be flying at an altitude of two stories. Look out your left hand window and you will see Vance Refrigeration. [snickering] I am the ghost of salesman past, do not come near me. [wheezing laughing, starts coughing] Yes Michael Scott for Dr. Jocelyn, please. Hello doctor I was just following up on my mole again. No, I was looking online about sebaceous cysts. I have not been squeezing it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [disgusted groan]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Could I stick it with a pin?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [still talking over PA] Toby Flenderson to the principal's office. Your mother called, and it appears that you wet the bed again. So you have to get home to wash your sheets [Jim stands up, puts scissors in back pocket] because they are yellow and they're wet with your urine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [sighs and knocks on Michaels door]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You, and at six foot six, from the University of North Carolina, Jiiiiim Halpeeeeert.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's pretty funny. Hey you know what? Did I drop my, uh...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What the heck? Is that, uh... [bends down, cuts phone cords with scissors]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You find it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I didn't, I'll look somewhere else.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Would you like fries with that? Please drive around.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [knocks on Pam's hotel door] Hello, good morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You ready? And we're off, like a herd of turtles.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, Pam and I have eloped. Actually we just robbed a bank, and we are on the lam. [laughs] No, uh,  seriously, I am on a lecture circuit. Apparently Scranton has the best sales of any regional branch. So David Wallace has asked me to go to all the branches, except Nashua, still a little bit raw there. Um, but I am going to these branches and sharing my secret recipe for success. My 11 business herbs and spices, in a sales batter. [looks at Pam] Oh that, well, that is Pam. Pam is coming along as my assistant and my driver so I can focus. And I like to pack heavy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He brought a sled.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No! That is a toboggan, you never know when you're gonna find a snowy hill so... Every magician has a hot assistant, and every rock star has a roadie, and Pam is my hot roadie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah. I love being on the road, but I especially love the time and a half pay 24 hours a day, for three days. Cause I have a mortgage now, got a bring home the bucks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, oh don't say bucks, it's not lady like. Here we go! [gets in backseat] Okay so what we do is drive all day and we stay in hotels together at night.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Separate rooms.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well that goes without saying.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm going to say it anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey! Look at what you're wearing again, Pam. Have you ever seen a magician's assistant?  That's...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: This is a new cardigan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: ...kind of [retches] Maybe you could tie it around your waist or lose the shirt underneath or something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. Oh, all right.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [front door slams, Kelly walks by] Hey, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Screw you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Excuse me, that is no way to address a superior.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Oh yeah? Screw you too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Whoa! What was that all about.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: You forgot her birthday, it was yesterday.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [Jim and Dwight sitting next to each other in talking head interview] Go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Go ahead, you do it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I insist.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Basically after Phyllis blackmailed Angela, Michael asked them to both step down from the party planning committee cause there was too much drama.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What he said was... [puts finger toward Jim's face]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [pushes Dwight's finger away] Just, easy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ...there was a problem with having one head of the party planning committee. She becomes too powerful, so he appointed two heads.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Party planning is literally the stupidest thing I have ever done in my life.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [at the same time as Jim] I am a paper salesman, this is humiliating. [shoves Jim's arm away] That's on my side.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So this is fun.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: My birthday was yesterday, and everybody forgot. I got really dressed up and  excited, and no one said a word. There wasn't even a party. I think sometimes people are really mean to the hot, popular girl.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Can I turn on the radio?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. I need silence or Sam Kinison to prepare.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: But then you fall asleep and there's nothing for me to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Then listen to your iPod, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That's dangerous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well then... hey you know what then let's just talk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: That's okay I can... I'm fine. I'll just play a song in my head.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You nervous about seeing Karen again, since she was the other woman? Actually you were the other woman so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, that was a long time ago.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Is that why your wearing makeup today?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, I'm not even wearing that much.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I hate the idea that someone out there hates me. I even hate thinking that Al-Qaeda hates me. I think if they got to know me, they wouldn't hate me. But Karen knows me, and she still hates me, so...

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: Oh, this is a nice office.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [laughs] You don't have to lie. Through here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Um Phyllis, who's that?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: She's out of your league Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: For your information, I have been with lots of beautiful women.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Sexually?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This conversation is over.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I am single now. What we have here, is the ultimate smackdown between the Nard-Dog and crippling despair, loneliness, and depression. I intend to win.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: We just wanted to say we are very sorry.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Screw you guys. You're dead to me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: If you say screw you one more time...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Yeah, screw you, beefer, I don't forget your birthday, I would never do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey, HEY.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [while Dwight and Kelly are arguing] Guys guys guys guys guys guys. We just want to make it up to you. What can we do?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I guess my only wish, would be that nothing so terrible would ever happen to anyone else ever again.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh God.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: In a way, it's good that it happened to me, because at least I can bear it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What kind of cake do you want imbecile.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Ice Cream.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [taking Michael's picture] Okay, uh, point at the Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello, Rolando, how are you?

quotes.speaker: Rolando
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Rolando, [clears throat] I'd like you to meet Pam. She is our receptionist. You know what? Maybe you guys could go out on a little friend date sometime.

quotes.speaker: Rolando
quotes.line: [sarcastically chuckles] Uh, your late, everyone's already in the conference room. Karen will be right here to take you over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, don't be nervous, just picture her naked.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Stop it, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what I do, steal my trick.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Please cut it out.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Hey. Hi, guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [notices Karen's pregnant] Oh my God. Is that Jim's?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: What!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Of course not!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Wow. Oh man! My head just exploded. Whoo! Thank God, for everybody right? Whoo kay. Wow, you're huge! That's incredible! I... God sorry, sorry my head is... I'm just, I'm trying to figure out the last time that you and Jim had sex, and...

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Let's just get this over with, shall we?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, Mm Hmm. Ten, ten months?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [partially blown up balloons on table and hanging from streamers] Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Well, I'm not done yet.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Dwight. This, [picks up balloon] fits in the palm of my hand. You haven't blown 'em up enough. Why have you chosen brown and gray balloons?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: They match the carpet

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What is that? [looks at sign that says "IT IS YOUR BIRTHDAY."] It is your birthday period.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's a statement of fact.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Not even an exclamation point?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is more professional. It's not like she discovered a cure for cancer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I can't believe how bad this looks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Are you trying to hurt my feeling? Because if so, you are succeeding. Fortunately, my feelings regenerate at twice the speed of a normal man's.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Okay, good then.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Have you collected the money from everyone?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I am working on it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How much do you have?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Six dollars.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [yelling] That's how much you and I contributed! I... Damn it Jim!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I said I was working on it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [looking into Julia's car] Trying to see what CD's she got. It's good to know the deets about the girl you're wooing. Eh, Aha! Fiest. Yes! [bangs on car and alarm goes off] Whoa! Aah, Aah! [backs up and runs into another car starting another alarm]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [on cell phone] NO! Oh, my God. Oh, No. That is so awful. That is the worst news. I have to go. I have to do a presentation. I'll talk to you... [hangs up phone, sighs] This is going to be hard for me to speak today. Because I just learned that my father has died. ... No, he didn't! He is alive. And this isn't even a cell phone. This is a calculator. But you bought it! And now you can't return it. Or can you? No you can't. [Karen raises her hand] Yes. Karen, do you need to go pump?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Not gonna have to do that, till after I have the baby. No, I am wondering. What are you talking about?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am talking about, how you all need to sell an experience. Like I sold you on the idea that my father had died.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: But now we think you're a liar.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Would a liar bring mini Mounds bars? [Pam tosses a handful of Mounds bars at everyone]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am a theatrical person. Growing up, I always thought I would become an actor. Because I have, these memorization tricks that I use. Um, for instance, I learned the Pledge of Allegiance by setting it to the tune of Old MacDonald. [starts singing] I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America, and to the republic for which it stands, one nation under God. With a woof-woof here, and a woof-woof there. Here a woof, there a woof. Everywhere a woof, woof. Um, you get it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I don't know you. But I need to know you in order to sell to you. That is why I have asked you to go around and tell me you names. I have an amazing mnemonic device, by which I have memorized all of your names. Shirty, mole, lazy eye, Mexico, baldy, sugar boobs, black woman. I have taken a unique part of who you are, and I have used that to memorize your name. Baldy, your head is bald. It is hairless. It is shiny, it is reflective like a mirror. "M" your name is Mark.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Got it. It works.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Uh, it's very insulting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: But it works. I would like you all to give this a shot. What do you say?

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: But we already know each other's names.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, then it will be easier for you. But I, I still think it's worthwhile, to give a, give it a try.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Okay. All right everyone, meeting's over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, I still have more.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Can I please see you in my office, please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She is pregnant. She is knocked up. "K" Karen. Pam, let's go.

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: I can't accept these prices, Stanley. They just cut our budget.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Brought you guys some coffees. Stanley, I know you have adult onset diabetes. So I put Splenda in yours. Let's see. How many did I put in there? [starts singing to the tune of Feist's 1234] One, Two, Three, Four Splenda's in your coffee, Stanley. None in yours, Julia, cause I don't know how you take it. But if you'd rather...

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Four Splenda. Are you crazy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, No, I actually only put in two. But that's not how the songs goes.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Are you out of your damn mind?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are you out of your damn mind? You bring an angel like that into this office, and you don't even set me up with her.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: We're not friends. I didn't think about it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We are friends. Stanley, we're friends. And you let me down.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: You really like her, huh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. I really like her with all my heart.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [thinks for a moment] Give me two clients for her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I grab this [grabs a chain saw], and I turn it on and I say, "Prepare yourself, for the Utica chain store massacre."

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: No that's, that is incredibly dangerous.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, don't worry, the chain is off.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No it's not.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: You know, I think I'm just gonna distill all this, and send it in an email to my team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Email's not scary. This is an opportunity. Don't, don't blow it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So when are you due?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Uh, in about a month.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow, that is wonderful, congratulations.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Thank you. It just all happened so fast.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: It's really amazing. Congratulations Karen. So is there a guy or, uh, a person. Or, uh, a sperm machine that did this to you, or?

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Yes, Michael. My husband impregnated me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: His name is Dan, uh, this is us. So dorky.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, he's cute.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Yeah, he's so cute. He's a dermatologist. We met a bar. Can you believe that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: What is happening there? [points at picture]

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. Don't even. That's really dorky.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: It's really sweet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, it's really dorky. You were right the first time.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: So, how are things in Scranton? How's Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, they're good. Uh, Jim's good. We're engaged.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: That's so great. That's great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Karen
quotes.line: Oh, my God. I'm so happy for you. [hugs pam]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Old hatreds dissolve into new friendships. It's a really wonderful moment.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I have to take care of a couple things. So Andy will be taking over things here. You're in good hands, and give my best to your mother.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So Julia, um, let's see. With regards to, uh, billing. Should we send bills to you, or to your boyfriend's house or?

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: No, it could go straight to our business address.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh Okay, all right. That makes sense. How does your boyfriend, deal with your phenomenal success? Is he just, like, totally threatened by you, or?

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: Actually, I, I don't have a boyfriend.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [stammers] Really? Is that... wow, that's so weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Guys, stop everything. I'm about to ask out this girl, and I'm completely panicking.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: [quietly] Oh, my desk is over... [quickly walks away]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: This gal, she's really into you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. Yeah. I mean, I've seen her, like, three times today. And we love all the same music, and whenever I walk into a room, she totally looks up.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: All right, all right. Say no more. So, this is how I got squeaky fromme. No small talk. Just show her who's the boss. Just go right in and kiss her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay, it sounds risky.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Have I ever steered you wrong, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wait, what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I would give that lecture a solid B+. Although, for the record, Karen. Wow, kind of mean.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I like her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really? No, honestly. Tell me what you really think.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm serious. Um, I'm really glad I came.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Because, um, cause I'll never wonder ever again. If I did something wrong and... Now I have closure. She's happy and, I don't know, it feels good.

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: Thanks for walking me out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, my pleasure. Yeah, there's all kinds of weirdo's out here, so...

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: You must be freezing.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I am about to die. [laughs] Will you wait here while I go get my jacket?

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: Oh, no, it's okay. This is my car.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Okay, Okay. Well listen, you're a new client, and as one of my new clients, you will always be taken care of. And that is the Nard-Dog guarantee.

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: What's a "Nard-Dog"?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [points to self] This is the Nard-Dog.

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: [Andy leans in to kiss her] Whoa. What the hell?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm sorry. Oh I, I thought we had this energy. And I'm a mess. And I just had my heart broken. And you came in today and your so pretty. You're, like, incredibly pretty.

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: I just got out of a relationship too. It's really hard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, right? Wow. Yeah. Do you want to talk about it? Go to a mall of something? Just walk around?

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: No, I, I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Sure, yeah that's... your right. It's too soon for... definitely too soon for me. So I'm glad we go that out of the way. I'm gonna be in touch with you. In three months. I'm gonna call you about that order. And maybe about that mall walk.

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: [chuckles] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Take care Julia.

quotes.speaker: Julia
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [as Julia is pulling out] Sorry I tried to kiss y...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We lost the account.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [struggling to blow up a balloon as his desk phone rings] Damn it! [answers phone] Dwight Schrute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [over the phone] How old's Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Who is this?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's Mose. Who do you think it is?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Mose doesn't know how to use a phone. So joke's on you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Look, I'm at the supermarket, and they only have numbered candles. How old is she?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Do you think I'm calling you for your best approximation?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [sighs] I'll call you back. [goes to a filling cabinet takes out a file and looks around]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I have here Kelly Kapoor's personal and confidental file. Allow me to share. [opens file]  "Kelly Kapoor spent April 1995 to December 1996 at Berks County Youth Center." Juvie. "According to past employers, it in no way affects her job perfor..."  Blah, Blah, Blah. [closes file]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Are you asleep?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No.  I'm just thinking about what you said, about Karen, about closure. You remember Holly? She used to work for H.R.?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: No, remind me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Blonde hair, nice boobs. Not too big, not too small.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Perfect boobs, [gives a look at the camera] of course I remember Holly.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: She was the love of my life. What you and Jim have times 100. Just she... she just left. And I didn't... I never got closure, you know? I never got closure with her. I haven't talked to her since. I haven't seen her since. And I feel like I need to go to Nashua and get closure. I feel like I need that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Okay, lets go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [scoofs] I'll just blow off the lecture at Rochester.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, screw 'em. Let's do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [chuckles] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [leaning against Creed's desk] So I am collecting $3 from everybody. For Kelly's party.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: I'd like to contribute.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, great.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: [opens wallet and hands Jim a single bill] There you go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [looks at a three dollar bill]
